alert.note: Alert for Canyon; Owyhee (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 03 at 10:14AM MDT until September 03 at 2:30PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: .Slow moving showers and thunderstorms with heavy rainfall have caused ponding and minor flooding near Huston, ID. Intermittent heavy rain due to continuing showers and thunderstorms will continue through the day in this area. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM MDT/1 PM PDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Idaho, including the following counties, Canyon and Owyhee. Portions of southeast Oregon, including the following county, Malheur. * WHEN...Until 200 PM MDT /100 PM PDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1011 AM MDT /911 AM PDT/, Trained weather spotters reported heavy rain and minor street flooding near Huston in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Caldwell, Homedale, Wilder, Marsing, Greenleaf, Notus, Huston and Lake Lowell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
